slides.title: WSL Mastery
slides.subtitle:
Complete Windows Subsystem for Linux Guide
From Installation to Advanced Development

list.text: What is WSL? - Windows Subsystem for Linux

box.content: Compatibility layer for running Linux binary executables natively on Windows

note.text: Key advantage: Run Linux commands and tools without dual-booting or using virtual machines!

list.text: Seamless - Run both Windows and Linux tools

box.code:
Windows 10/11 Host
â”œâ”€â”€ Windows Kernel
â”œâ”€â”€ WSL2 Virtual Machine
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Real Linux Kernel
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ Systemd & Init
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Linux Distribution
â”œâ”€â”€ P9 File System Server
â””â”€â”€ WSLg (GUI Support)

Key Components:
â€¢ Lightweight Utility VM
â€¢ Real Linux Kernel (Microsoft-built)
â€¢ Seamless file system integration
â€¢ Integrated networking stack

# Install WSL with default Ubuntu
dism.exe /online /enable-feature /featurename:Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux /all /norestart

# Or use the new command (Windows 10 2004+)
wsl --install

# Install specific distribution
wsl --install -d Ubuntu-22.04
wsl --install -d Debian
wsl --install -d Kali-Linux

# List installed distributions
wsl --list --verbose

# Set default WSL version
wsl --set-default-version 2

# Set default distribution
wsl --set-default Ubuntu-22.04

# Run specific distribution
wsl -d Ubuntu-22.04

# Run command in WSL without entering shell
wsl ls -la

# Shutdown WSL
wsl --shutdown

# Terminate specific distribution
wsl --terminate Ubuntu-22.04

# Linux home directory (WSL filesystem)
/home/username/
  â”œâ”€â”€ .bashrc
  â”œâ”€â”€ .ssh/
  â”œâ”€â”€ projects/
  â””â”€â”€ ...

# Windows drives (mounted)
/mnt/c/          # C: drive
/mnt/d/          # D: drive
/mnt/e/          # E: drive

# Access Windows from Linux
cd /mnt/c/Users/username/Desktop

# Access Linux from Windows
# Explorer path: \\wsl$\Ubuntu-22.04\home\username

# Update package lists
sudo apt update

# Upgrade installed packages
sudo apt upgrade

# Install new package
sudo apt install package-name

# Remove package
sudo apt remove package-name

# Search for packages
apt search "keyword"

# Clean up
sudo apt autoremove
sudo apt autoclean

# Install Git and SSH
sudo apt install git openssh-client

# Generate SSH key
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

# Start SSH agent
eval "$(ssh-agent -s)"

# Add SSH key to agent
ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519

# Configure Git
git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email "your_email@example.com"

# Copy SSH public key to clipboard
cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub | clip.exe

# Install Remote Development extension in VS Code
# Then connect to WSL:

1. Open VS Code
2. Press Ctrl+Shift+P
3. Type "Remote-WSL: New Window"
4. Select your WSL distribution

# Features:
â€¢ Edit files in WSL file system
â€¢ Use WSL terminal in VS Code
â€¢ Run and debug in WSL environment
â€¢ Install extensions in WSL context
â€¢ Seamless Git integration

# From WSL terminal:
code .  # Opens current directory in VS Code

# From WSL, access Windows files:
cd /mnt/c/Users/YourName/Desktop
cd /mnt/c/Projects/my-project

# From Windows, access WSL files:
# File Explorer: \\wsl$\
# Or: \\wsl$\Ubuntu-22.04\home\username

# Best practices:
â€¢ Store project files in Windows for backup
â€¢ Use WSL for development operations
â€¢ Avoid editing Linux system files from Windows
â€¢ Use /home/username for WSL-specific configs

# List available drives
wsl --mount --list

# Mount a drive (replace X with drive letter)
wsl --mount \\.\X:

# Mount with specific filesystem
wsl --mount \\.\X: -t ext4

# Unmount a drive
wsl --unmount \\.\X:

# Access mounted drive in WSL
cd /mnt/x/

# Mount USB drives, external HDDs, etc.

list.text: File Open - Open files in default apps

box.code:
# Install Zsh and Oh-My-Zsh
sudo apt install zsh
sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)"

# Popular plugins:
â€¢ zsh-autosuggestions
â€¢ zsh-syntax-highlighting
â€¢ git plugin (built-in)

# Configure WSL settings in /etc/wsl.conf
[network]
hostname = my-wsl

[interop]
appendWindowsPath = false

# Windows Terminal settings:
â€¢ Custom color schemes
â€¢ Different profiles per distro
â€¢ Background images
â€¢ Key bindings

# Export distribution to tar file
wsl --export Ubuntu-22.04 ubuntu-backup.tar

# Import from tar file as new distribution
wsl --import New-Ubuntu C:\WSL\New-Ubuntu ubuntu-backup.tar

# List all distributions
wsl --list --all

# Unregister/delete distribution
wsl --unregister Ubuntu-22.04

# Backup entire WSL environment:
1. Export each distribution
2. Backup Windows Terminal settings
3. Save wsl.conf configurations
4. Export VS Code extensions list

# Check current WSL version
wsl --list --verbose

# Set WSL2 as default version
wsl --set-default-version 2

# Convert existing distribution
wsl --set-version Ubuntu-22.04 2

# Requirements for WSL2:
â€¢ Windows 10 Version 2004 or later
â€¢ Virtualization enabled in BIOS
â€¢ Windows Subsystem for Linux feature
â€¢ Virtual Machine Platform feature

# Verify conversion
wsl --list --verbose

# Check WSL status
wsl --status

# Generate diagnostic log
wsl --system

# Check distribution status
wsl -l -v

# Restart WSL service
wsl --shutdown

# Event logs in Windows:
Event Viewer â†’ Windows Logs â†’ System

# WSL logs location:
%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Temp

# Enable verbose logging:
Add to %USERPROFILE%\.wslconfig:
[WSL2]
kernelCommandLine = "systemd.unit=multi-user.target debug"

Installation & Management:
wsl --install                    # Install WSL
wsl --list --verbose            # List distributions
wsl --set-default-version 2     # Set WSL2 as default
wsl --shutdown                  # Shutdown WSL
wsl --terminate <distro>        # Stop specific distro

Distribution Management:
wsl --export <distro> file.tar  # Export distribution
wsl --import <name> path file.tar # Import distribution
wsl --unregister <distro>       # Remove distribution

File System:
/mnt/c/                         # Access C: drive
/mnt/d/                         # Access D: drive
\\wsl$\<distro>                 # Access WSL from Windows

Common Operations:
wsl <command>                   # Run Linux command
code .                          # Open VS Code in current dir
 explorer.exe .                 # Open Windows Explorer
